text:
Broadway, south of Halsey Street, showing the Broadway Elevated line of the B.M.T.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Broadway, east side, south from Halsey Street. (In 1871 Paul W. Ledoux, a Canadian who resided in New York City, bought a lot of land bounded by Broadway, Bushwick ave., and Eldert and Halsey Streets, on which 13 stores and several dwellings were erected. In 1891, he refused $100,000 for a 200 feet frontage on Broadway. In 1905 he sold 180' X 100' on Broadway for $225,000. He, among others, was instrumental in having the Halsey Street trolley line extended). Overhead is a portion of the Broadway line of the Brooklyn Elevated system.

July 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Halsey Street, north side, west from Broadway.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Halsey Street, north side, west from Broadway, showing the Halsey Street Trolley Line.

1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
